command: try { $key=$env:RISKIQ_API_KEY; $sec=$env:RISKIQ_API_SECRET; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($key) -or [string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($sec)){ throw 'Missing RISKIQ credentials'; }; $basic=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes("$key`:$sec")); $uri="https://api.riskiq.net/pt/v2/dns/passive?query=example.com"; $resp=Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri $uri -Headers @{Authorization=("Basic " + $basic); Accept='application/json'} -TimeoutSec 25 -ErrorAction Stop; $resp | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\ti_t1597.log" -Value ("[RiskIQ PassiveTotal] " + $_.Exception.Message) }
explanation: Retrieves passive DNS data for example.com from RiskIQ PassiveTotal, a subscription-only closed-source dataset useful for infrastructure pivoting. Uses Basic Auth and outputs JSON.
rationale_steps: Pull API key/secret from environment and create a Basic Auth header.
Issue a targeted passive DNS query to limit noise.
Use HTTPS with proper Accept header and short timeout.
Return JSON and log errors to a file if the request fails.
